chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashawn Andre Anderson

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Defendant Rashawn Andre Anderson in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Rashawn Andre Anderson.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, continuing with prelim hearing.  State calls Officer Mitch Westlund, sworn in, State questions.  Record reflects witness identifies the def.  Atty questions witness.  No redirect.  Court finds PC that def has committed a felony in Ashland County.  Case is bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now contains same charges.  Atty, acknowledge information, waives reading, pleads NG on the two counts, entered.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:05 AM Defendant Rashawn Andre Anderson appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Rashawn Andre Anderson.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty proceed with prelim.  State calls Officer Westlund, sworn in, State questions.  Court adjourned to in person.  Previous waiver of time limits.  Quality of audio not good, parties to appear in person.   Atty permission to zoom, def and witnesses to appear in person.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
